intro: Ptilotus fusiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its slender, spiral-shaped stems and small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Ptilotus fusiformis is noted for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed sites.
